DataElement.preferredName: Resected Tissue Gross Pathologic Examination Pathology Ink Use Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication of whether pathology ink was used to mark the resected tissue.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Resected Tissue Gross Pathologic Examination Pathology Ink Use
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._Having been removed by surgery._An assessment of macroscopic pathological findings that are caused by disease._Medical grade dye or pigment that is applied to surgically removed tissue specimens to maintain orientation and indicate tumor resection margins._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Resected; having been removed by surgery.:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Property.preferredName: Gross Pathologic Examination Pathology Ink Use
Property.preferredDefinition: An assessment of macroscopic pathological findings that are caused by disease.:Medical grade dye or pigment that is applied to surgically removed tissue specimens to maintain orientation and indicate tumor resection margins.:A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

Concepts.definition: An assessment of macroscopic pathological findings that are caused by disease.
Medical grade dye or pigment that is applied to surgically removed tissue specimens to maintain orientation and indicate tumor resection margins.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
